title: High ping, Vancouver, BC, Canada. (ISP Shaw)
body: Getting a solid 250 ping tonight. Other friends on Shaw seem to be running into the same issue. Attached the results. Contacted Shaw, the problem seems to be out of their jurisdiction. Rito pls.

replies.body:
I'm in Winnipeg but I'm connecting through the same route as you guys. Goes to the west coast then south across the border to the rito servers. 280~ ping
This started a couple hours ago.

I won't post the whole tracert log, but the major jump is between shaw washington and six.riotgames.com

5    45 ms    46 ms    49 ms  rc5wt-tge0-4-0-10.wa.shawcable.net [66.163.70.214]
6     *      280 ms   255 ms  six.riotgames.com [206.81.81.42]

Noticing pretty high packet loss as well, 50%~

Edit: Just tested it out again, it's sitting at a cool 51ms. Going to queue an aram or something test it out.
hey uh ofc sona here, having this problem too I just want to say fuck you know? fuck riot, and fuck this lottery ping isp.
problem still presist
same problem here...Shaw in Winnipeg
Yep, happening to me to 250(ms) Vancouver, BC.

Im having the same issues. Looked around on Reddit and there are definitely other people, all with shaw getting high ping. [Here](http://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/2znxfe/really_high_ping_since_servers_went_down/) is one small thread with people complaining.
With shaw in Vancouver BCand lately I have been getting a constant 1000 ping in league. When I do a speed test it says I have 10 ping
Same problem here in Edmonton, Alberta with Shaw. My friends with Shaw in Calgary are also having the same issue.

Gonna bump this again cause it's the same issue again. 

16, 25, 18 ms from wa.shawcable.net (66.163.74.158)
208, 228, 208 ms from six.riotgames.com (206.81.81.42)

Who's in charge of that server? Seems like they're spilling coffee on it every few days...

Ping spikes randomly, usually around every 5 minutes or more frequently, every 10 seconds, lasting for around 5 seconds. For some reason when i'm in a Skype call with someone, the call freezes too when i get the spikes, don't know why.
This is also affecting me. I'm also with Shaw, and also in BC. Important to note that nothing else is lagging. Skype is perfectly fine, Teamspeak is fine, it's just league...
Same here.  Been playing this game at night time in Vancouver(PST zone) arv. 250-300 Ping. Please look into it. thanks
Same problem here, I recently started getting 250-300 ping when playing. I'm also with Shaw. Not worth playing at all with that ping. : (
Shaw is the equivalent of comcast from america
fuck, DW guys I told Iaw from GD about this

I'm getting somewhat laggy games, around 100ish ms, compared to the usual 15 - 30 ms. Occasionally, it'll spike to 140 - 250. Shaw, Vancouver, B.C.

I remember Riot recently did some server tweaks to run well with multiple ISP, I recall Shaw was involved. Not sure if this lag is related or if it's on Shaw side.
Still can't play in a ranked game right now kept getting timed out

Same problem, next day. Glad I just did a custom to check instead of joining a friend. Since Riot clearly has better things to respond to then their support board, I'll just start playing something else.
Never had this problem back when I used Telus. I don't know why I switched to Shaw, jessu christ

The game is unplayable at 300ms ping. Yesterday there was another thread in 'Report a Bug' regarding this issue, but it looks like it has been deleted; I'm not sure why (it should have simply been moved here). I'm also not sure where the Riot reps are, I haven't heard *anything at all* from them -- are they working to resolve the issue? Has it already been fixed? What is the problem? I'm pretty disappointed in the lack of Riot's care for its paying customers...
Exact same as Syn Bot, it's unplayable.. not going to try again for a couple days unless we actually get some kind of response because it's not worth the trouble.

Seems that its when they are doing their network maintenance for the new network or something. Same in Calgary (Shaw) only after ~9:00pm until sometime in the night. Pretty frustrating, although I feel like we've seen this issue before a year ago or so. Definitely upvoting everything related to it..

From what the tracer shows, the problem is somewhere in California. Nothing Shaw can do about it =/. I feel like Rito should've rerouted Shaw users if they knew there was some maintenance going on for one of the links.
This is happening to me too.... Guess I'm switching to telus =/ thx rito
I used to have Telus. It wasn't much better. The only ISP that seems to have nothing but good reviews, is Novus. But they only cater to a few apartments, mainly in the downtown core.
